newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks sees lower costs and prices.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks sees lower costs and prices.

text.p: Bay Networks said its merger with LANcity Corp should enable it to cut prices of the advanced cable modems that LANcity currently manufactures.

"Basically, today, LANcity has a price of $599," said Bruce Sachs, executive vice president of Bay Networks Internet/Telecomm Business unit on a conference call. Sachs said the combined companies will begin rolling out a co-branded product immediately with the closure of the $54 million merger. "And, as volume grows, we're expecting its price to drop over time," he said. Sachs said he expected the deal to close September 24 and be accounted for as a purchase.
